paragraphs.body: It's 12:40 AM EST as I type this message, and I've just recieved word that Olorin is officially going inactive for the next 1-3 weeks. See here. If you took the time to read his post, he has left his membership in this user group up to us. I will put this to a vote. Votes will be counted, and the course of action will be determined by the majority ruling. As such, I (regretably and lamentably) vote to revoke his TT membership. He has been neither persistant nor consistant in his edits, and this is a poor reflection of the TT. My vote stands as stated. Polls close at 11:00 PM EST May 23, 2011. Bassmasta2012 (talk • contribs) 04:47, May 23, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: What they are saying will always be the same, whether you wrote it yourself or copied it from a site. The problem is that you cannot copy what is happening, that’s something you should write yourself. Lady Lostris (talk • contribs) 17:22, May 25, 2011 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: What they are saying will always be the same, whether you wrote it yourself or copied it from a site. The problem is that you cannot copy what is happening, that’s something you should write yourself. Lady Lostris (talk • contribs) 17:22, May 25, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Just a thought, but is it possible to organize the transcripts according to the three different books? I think it would be easier for us to see which transcripts are already written and someone who's looking for a particular transcript will be able to find it more easily. I'm just tossing an idea around here, so no hard feelings if you don't like it. Lady Lostris (talk • contribs) 23:48, May 23, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: I've noticed several different variations of table formatting, and I'd like to know which one is correct. For example, while the ${link_0} has no Act headings, it still has gaps separating the acts. Yet many other transcripts do not have these gaps. I've also noticed that ${link_1} uses a darker background color for scene actions. Should all transcripts have this?

links.body: The Boy in the Iceberg transcript

paragraphs.text: I've noticed several different variations of table formatting, and I'd like to know which one is correct. For example, while the The Boy in the Iceberg transcript has no Act headings, it still has gaps separating the acts. Yet many other transcripts do not have these gaps. I've also noticed that The Ember Island Players transcript uses a darker background color for scene actions. Should all transcripts have this?

paragraphs.body: Secondly, many transcripts have the names of characters (or events) linked to their respective articles. As mentioned on my talk page, I am not responsible for adding any of these links; however, Bass has informed me that there should be no links. I think that information should be posted under the rules on the TT's main page, so that everyone can see it. Katara20 (talk • contribs) 16:29, May 30, 2011 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Secondly, many transcripts have the names of characters (or events) linked to their respective articles. paragraphs.body: I wish to be as respectful to the Transcript Team as possible, and I want for this simply marvelous group to succeed; however, my contributions to the Team have been neither persistent nor helpful, and due to this I am forced to admit that I am not the best candidate for the group. Therefore, I respectfully resign with the knowledge that the Team will continue to excel in its transcripts, its interviews, and its tabling. I am sincerely sorry to have to resign, but I realize I am not suited to such a daunting task. I who am about to resign salute you. TAD, theavatardemotivator - talk  19:26, June 2, 2011 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: I wish to be as respectful to the Transcript Team as possible, and I want for this simply marvelous group to succeed; however, my contributions to the Team have been neither persistent nor helpful, and due to this I am forced to admit that I am not the best candidate for the group. Therefore, I respectfully resign with the knowledge that the Team will continue to excel in its transcripts, its interviews, and its tabling. I am sincerely sorry to have to resign, but I realize I am not suited to such a daunting task. I who am about to resign salute you. TAD, theavatardemotivator - talk  19:26, June 2, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Should the voting be held publicly in the war room or just between the members? Sorry to bother you again, but I have another question :-) Whe [blabla] is used in a text, the text is italicazed, but sometimes it is only the text and sometimes the [] are italicazed as well. So...which one is it? Only the text or everything? I do everything, but I actually don't know if that is what I am supposed to do. Lady Lostris 13:57, June 9, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Due to a load of things that are appearing in my schedule for this week and next week, there will be a reduction in my activity. I'll probably still visit Wiki, however, I won't be working on transcripts or mainspace articles when here. Specific reasons for reduction in activity: Being that I'm in eighth grade and graduating this year, I have several events coming up including graduation itself, prom, etc. Next week I'll be studying and reviewing for the New York State Regents exams. The tests end by Friday, June 17th. June 17th is when I will resume editing. Thank you for your understanding. The Ultimate Waterbender 11:42, June 9, 2011 (UTC)

I'll probably still visit Wiki, however, I won't be working on transcripts or mainspace articles when here. Specific reasons for reduction in activity: Being that I'm in eighth grade and graduating this year, I have several events coming up including graduation itself, prom, etc. Next week I'll be studying and reviewing for the New York State Regents exams. The tests end by Friday, June 17th. June 17th is when I will resume editing. Thank you for your understanding. The Ultimate Waterbender 11:42, June 9, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: I don't know when or why, but an anonymous contributor has began constructing the page for "The Eclipse". Let it be known that the "Day of Black Sun" transcripts were reserved exclusively for me when the project started. I'd like someone to remove the tables from the page. I will let everyone know when it has been cleared for reformatting. Bassmasta2012 (talk • contribs) 12:45, June 11, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Some of you may have already read the fact that Bass and I can't seem to agree on the table format, so we decided to do a poll to settle the discussion. Whichever option gets the most votes will -obviously- be the "winner" and the format that will be used for all the transcripts. So please leave your vote and -if you like- the reason why below. The poll will stay "open" (not that it can be closed) until all the TT-members have voted. Thank you. Lady Lostris 08:36, June 16, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Hey guys. Just needed to let you know about my pending cutback in editing activity. I start band camp tomorrow, and it runs through the next two weeks. I'll still be on in the afternoons and evenings to complete my proofreading edits, and post a few comments, depending on the conclusion of afternoon rehearsals, but won't be able to get on during the day. It would be helpful to me if you guys could convert some of the pages to tables while I'm offline. These should take priority over the newer pages for the time being. Like I said, I'll still be here to make some constructive edits, just not as much. Bassmasta2012 (talk • contribs) 21:28, June 19, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Bass, question: is it really necessary to wait for your approval before adding a table to the transcript? I just think that if we do it as we go, it saves us a lot of time afterwards as adding a table to a whole, long transcript is very tedious and annoying work. As far as I know, the reason why we don't do it now is because it's not as easy for you to proofread, but I actually don't see what the problem is with proofreading an already tabled transcrip. We elaborate tabled transcripts all the time and that works just as fine as elaborating an un-tabled one, but you have the advantage that you no longer need to add the table aftarwards when you're done ^^. Lady Lostris vstf (talk • HotN) 10:25, August 20, 2011 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Bass, question: is it really necessary to wait for your approval before adding a table to the transcript? I just think that if we do it as we go, it saves us a lot of time afterwards as adding a table to a whole, long transcript is very tedious and annoying work. As far as I know, the reason why we don't do it now is because it's not as easy for you to proofread, but I actually don't see what the problem is with proofreading an already tabled transcrip. We elaborate tabled transcripts all the time and that works just as fine as elaborating an un-tabled one, but you have the advantage that you no longer need to add the table aftarwards when you're done ^^. Lady Lostris vstf (talk • HotN) 10:25, August 20, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Now that you mention it, it does seem like a waste to hold off on tabling the pages. I can, and have proofread pages with tabling, and I know a thing or two about tedious work. Proofreading these things is just as tedious, even if I find no mistakes. I have nothing to lose, so I hereby clear all existing and yet to be created pages for tabling. I'll revise the rules shortly. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. Bassmasta2012 (talk • contribs) 12:28, August 20, 2011 (UTC)
